Cookie Policy

Last updated: January 1st, 2026

1. What are cookies?

Cookies are small text files that the websites you visit save on your computer or mobile device. They allow the website to remember your actions and preferences (such as login, language, font size, and other display preferences) over a period of time, so you don't have to keep re-entering them whenever you come back to the site or browse from one page to another.

2. How do I use cookies?

On this website, I use cookies solely to improve functionality and user experience. I do not use advertising or invasive tracking cookies.

I use the following types of local storage and cookies:

  • Theme Preferences: I save your choice of "Dark Mode" or "Light Mode" so the site looks the way you prefer every time you visit.
  • Cookie Consent: I save a small record to know that you have already accepted my cookie banner and not to show it to you indiscriminately again.

3. Third-Party Cookies

This site may include embedded content (e.g., FontAwesome icons or CDN scripts) that could set their own cookies. I have no control over these external cookies.

4. How to control cookies

You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. However, if you do this, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site and some services and functionalities may not work (such as the automatic Theme mode).

For more information, you can contact me via the channels listed on the main page.
